intro: Phlegmariurus mandiocanus, commonly known as the Brazilian clubmoss, is a member of the family Lycopodiaceae and is native to South America. It is a small, evergreen shrub that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a distinctive appearance with erect, branching stems and small, scale-like leaves. Its reproductive structures, known as strobila, are cone-like and contain spores. Phlegmariurus mandiocanus plays an important ecological role in its habitat by contributing to soil stability and providing shelter for various microorganisms.
